It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often covered in fine, soft hairs. It thrives in humid environments and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
